input: Imagine a self-contained, hypothetical world with only the following conditions, and without any unmentioned factors or causal relationships: Age has a direct effect on hospital costs and recovery. Hospital costs has a direct effect on recovery. The overall probability of high hospital bill is 51%. The probability of low hospital bill and recovery is 16%. The probability of high hospital bill and recovery is 36%. Is the chance of recovery smaller when observing high hospital bill?
